alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:21AM CDT until April 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...From late Sunday night to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, A few of the lowest dwellings adjacent to the Snake River, Cross Lake and Pokegama Lake need protection from flood waters. At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning to a crest of 9.0 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 04/12/1969. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this evening by 930 PM CDT.
